intro: Anthephora hochstetteri var. glabra, commonly known as the smooth anthephora, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The leaves are typically opposite and have a smooth, glabrous surface, giving the plant its varietal name. It produces small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters, often attracting various pollinators. This species is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
